  1. Home
  2. Government
  3. Departments

The Brazoria Municipal Court’s primary function is to process all Class C Criminal charges filed by the Police Department, Animal Control, Fire Marshall, and Code Enforcement Officers alleged to have occurred within the territorial limits of the City of Brazoria. Charges include the Texas Transportation Code, Penal Code, Alcoholic Beverage Code, Health and Safety Code, Education Code, and Brazoria Code of Ordinances.

ADDRESS BRAZORIA MUNICIPAL COURT

Brazoria, TX  77422

Window Hours:  Monday through Thursday  7:30am to 5:00pm Friday 8:00am to 12:00pm

/DocumentCenter/View/1018

Adjudication of Class C Misdemeanors

  • Convenient payment options with the acceptance of all major credit cards; use our Pay Location Code 8743, service fee will be applied
The Court may issue an arrest warrant when: are issued for defendants who received a citation and/or a court date and failed to appear in Court when scheduled or fail to resolve their case prior to their court date. If you have an Arrest Warrant (not a Capias Pro-Fine), your options are:
  • Surrender yourself to the City of Brazoria Police Department located at:                                 114 E. Texas St.  Brazoria, TX  77422
Capias Pro-Fine Warrant s are issued on defendants who received a citation, have been found guilty by the court, and failed to comply with orders of the court. If you have a Capias Pro-Fine warrant, your options are:
  • Surrender yourself to the City of Brazoria Police Department located at:                                 114 E. Texas St.  Brazoria, TX  77422
Persons with Warrants are subject to arrest at any time.  The City of Brazoria Police Department is actively looking for you.  To avoid arrest, you must immediately resolve this matter by contacting the Brazoria Municipal Court at 979-798-2165.

Payment options for warrants issued by the City of Brazoria Municipal Court are as follows:

  • Online:  www.allpaid.com  use pay location 8743 answer YES to have you entered a plea
  • Phone:  1-888-604-7888  use pay location 8743 answer YES to have you entered a plea
  • Mail:  Brazoria Municipal Court  201 S Main St., Brazoria, TX  77422
  • In Person:  Brazoria Municipal Court  201 S. Main St., Brazoria, TX  77422
Forms of Payment:  Cash, Money Order, Cashier's Check, or Credit/Debit Card. All Arrest Warrants or Affidavits made in support of the warrant are public information
  1. Citation Guidelines
  2. Juveniles
  3. Docket Re-set
  4. Payment Plans
  1. Citation Guidelines
  • You are age 17 or older
  • If you are aged 17-24 additional conditions shall apply when requesting DD

/DocumentCenter/View/1027

  1. Juveniles
A Juvenile is defined as a person between the ages of 10-16.  Any citation issued to a juvenile is required by law to have a parent or legal guardian present with them in open court to answer to the charge.  These cases may only be seen/heard before the judge on the scheduled appearance date on your citation.
  1. Docket Re-set
Judge James will allow upon request one reset of your court appearance date.  All request should be made before your scheduled appearance date and could be extended until the next scheduled court date.  If you need your citation's appearance date reset, please contact the court by phone at (979) 798-2165.
  1. Payment Plans
Payment Plans may be entered into on citations and Arrest Warrants only.  Judge James requires that you appear in person to request a payment plan.  Be prepared to make a down payment of at least 1/3 of your total fines/cost of your citation.  Down payments on warrants vary between 1/3 to 1/2 down, depending on the age of the warrant.  To know how much your fine/cost may be and how much a down payment is needed, please call the Court at (979) 798-2165 One of Judge James' many outside activities is performing marriage ceremonies.  If you would like to see about Judge James performing yours just contact the court for details!
